description: '''Tahona''', alternatively spelled '''tajona''' due to its pronunciation or '''taona''', is a secular style of [[Music of Cuba|Afro-Cuban music]] developed in the 19th century in [[Santiago de Cuba]] after the arrival of Haitian slaves following the [[Haitian Revolution]]. It is named after the ensembles and the drums played by them. It is considered one of the oldest styles within the [[Cuban rumba|rumba complex]], and its performance became rare by the 20th century.
